sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Genealogical Roll (Creation to temp. Edward IV)
[Untitled Vellum Roll]
msDesc.p:
Vellum roll,
427 11,900
, 16.8 broad x 468 long, on sixteen skins. Cent. xv, circ. 1470?. It is written on both sides. The top is torn.

On it is an old written label:
Rotula Reg.. Anglic. Gall, et L(atine) script. 23.

head.title: Genealogical Roll (Creation to temp. Edward IV)

ab.decoNote: at top a figure of Eve with distaff, below her a figure of Adam delving

msItem.ab: Until we reach Eneas, there are only medallions inscribed with names, after that the text begins
msItem.incipit: En la noble cite de graunt troie ili auoit un noble chiualer
msItem.ab: Some periods are copiously treated, others very briefly

ab.decoNote: The Welsh princes occupy the central line: the English kings are on R.

msItem.ab: At and after Edmond le filz Athelrede, the pedigree of Lacy occupies the L. side, illustrated with shields
At Henry III the pedigree of the Conte Mareschalle begins

ab.handNote: The original hand I think ended with the shield of Monsr Richard heir lineale al duchie de ȝork et al countee de la marche et duluestre et ffoundre de Wygemore

msItem.ab: The subsequent medallions are added by another hand: they contain the names of Edwardus dei gratia verus et indubitatus Rex (Edward IV), of Lady Anne daughter of Richard of York, and of Lady Anne, eldest daughter of Henry of Exeter, born in 1461
the text is begun at the top and broken off; it is resumed lower down

ab.q: Considerans historic britonum pictorum scotorum anglorum danorum ac normanorum prolixitatem

msItem.ab: The text is in Latin, giving a genealogy from Adam to Henry V, without illustrations

recordHist.p: remarks: Final loci will be added after filming and will be based on the digi file names. Despite the difficulty, CCC will also provide measurements of the chronicle rolls but again will wait for filming.
